intro: Protionopsis pubescens, commonly known as the hairy protion, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Protionopsis pubescens produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months of the year.
